summary: The Health Access Innovation Act of 2025 aims to amend the Public Health Service Act to authorize the Secretary of Health and Human Services to award grants to faith- or community-based organizations. These grants will fund initiatives focused on expanding access to culturally and linguistically appropriate healthcare, addressing health inequities and chronic diseases, and supporting community health workers. The bill outlines eligible entities, grant priorities, and authorizes specific appropriations for fiscal years 2026-2029.
